zclOTAUCluster.h File Reference

The header file describes the OTAU cluster interface. ZigBee Document 095264r17. Revision 17 Version 0.7 March 14, 2010. More...

#include <zclParser.h>
#include <zcl.h>
#include <clusters.h>
#include <ofdExtMemory.h>

Go to the source code of this file.

ZCL_Cluster_t ZCL_GetOtauClientCluster (void)
 Gets Otau's cluster.
ZCL_Cluster_t ZCL_GetOtauServerCluster (void)
 Gets Otau's cluster.
ZCL_Status_t ZCL_StartOtauService (ZCL_OtauInitParams_t *pInitParam, ZCL_OtauStatInd_t ind)
 OTAU parametres initialization. Start server discovery procedure on client side or start server.
ZCL_Status_t ZCL_StopOtauService (ZCL_OtauInitParams_t *pInitParam)
 Stop OTAU service. (It is not implemented for client)
bool zclIsOtauBusy (void)
 Checks whether OTAU cluster is busy or not.
bool ZCL_UnsolicitedUpgradeEndResp (ZCL_Addressing_t *addressing, ZCL_OtauUpgradeEndResp_t *resp)
 The server may send an unsolicited Upgrade End Response command to the client. This may be used for example if the server wants to synchronize the upgrade on multiple clients simultaneously.
bool ZCL_ImageNotifyReq (ZCL_Addressing_t *addressing, ZCL_OtauImageNotify_t *resp)
 This is called by the server to send image notify command to client.
void ZCL_ConfigureOtauImageKey (void(*configureKeyDone)())

Variables

ZCL_OtauClusterClientAttributes_t otauClientAttributes

Detailed Description

The header file describes the OTAU cluster interface. ZigBee Document 095264r17. Revision 17 Version 0.7 March 14, 2010.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file zclOTAUCluster.h.

Define Documentation

#define DEFINE_OTAU_CLIENT_ATTRIBUTES
Value:
DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE(upgradeServerID, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_UPGRADE_SERVER_ID, ZCL_IEEE_ADDRESS_DATA_TYPE_ID), \
        DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE(imageUpgradeStatus, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IMAGE_UPGRADE_STATUS_ID, ZCL_8BIT_ENUM_DATA_TYPE_ID), \
        DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY(blockRequestDelay, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_MINIMUM_BLOCK_REQUEST_DELAY_ID, \
                                                  ZCL_U16BIT_DATA_TYPE_ID, 0x0000, 0x0258), \
        DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY(clusterRevision, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_CLUSTER_REVISION_ID, \
                                                  ZCL_U16BIT_DATA_TYPE_ID, 0x0001, 0xfffe), \
        DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY(upgradeActivationPolicy, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_UPGRADE_ACTIVATION_POLICY_ID, \
                                                  ZCL_8BIT_ENUM_DATA_TYPE_ID, 0x00, 0x01), \
        DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY(upgradeTimeoutPolicy, ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE, ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_CLIENT_UPGRADE_TIMEOUT_POLICY_ID, \
                                                  ZCL_8BIT_ENUM_DATA_TYPE_ID, 0x00, 0x01)

#define OTAU_CLUSTER_ZCL_SERVER_CLUSTER_TYPE (   clattributes,
  clcommands 
)
Value:
{                                                                           \
    .id = OTAU_CLUSTER_ID,                                                    \
    .options = {                                                              \
      .type = ZCL_SERVER_CLUSTER_TYPE,                                        \
      .security = ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY,                           \
      .reserved = 0},                                                         \
    .attributesAmount = ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_SERVER_ATTRIBUTES_AMOUNT,            \
    .attributes = (uint8_t *) clattributes,                                   \
    .commandsAmount = ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_COMMANDS_AMOUNT,                       \
    .commands = (uint8_t *) clcommands                                        \
  }

ZCL OTAU Cluster server side defining macros.

Parameters:
attributes- pointer to cluster server attributes (ZCL_OtauClusterClientAttributes_t) or NULL if there are no attributes
clcommands- pointer to cluster server commands or NULL if there are no commands
Returns:
None

Definition at line 204 of file zclOTAUCluster.h.

#define ZCL_IMAGE_BLOCK_RESP_HEADER_SIZE
Value:
( sizeof(ZCL_Status_t) + sizeof(uint16_t) + sizeof(ZCL_OtauImageType_t) \
              + sizeof(ZCL_OtauFirmwareVersion_t) + sizeof(uint32_t) + sizeof(uint8_t) )

Definition at line 220 of file zclOTAUCluster.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ZCL_ImageNotifyPayloadType_t

Payload type field for Image Notify command.

Enumerator:
OTAU_PAYLOAD_TYPE_QUERY_JITTER 

Query jitter.

OTAU_PAYLOAD_TYPE_MANUFACTURER_CODE 

Query jitter and manufacturer code.

OTAU_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE_TYPE 

Query jitter, manufacturer code and image type.

OTAU_PAYLOAD_TYPE_NEW_FILE_VERSION 

Query jitter, manufacturer code, image type, and new file version.

OTAU_PAYLOAD_TYPE_RESERVED 

Values 0x04 - 9xFF are reserved.

Definition at line 306 of file zclOTAUCluster.h.

Function Documentation

bool zclIsOtauBusy ( void  )

Checks whether OTAU cluster is busy or not.

Returns:
true - if OTAU cluster is busy, false - otherwise.
